00033 #define GF_ALLOC(v,t,s) \
00034 { \
00035   v = (t*)malloc((s) * sizeof(t)); \
00036   if ((v) == NULL) { \
00037     throw OutOfMemoryException( \
00038         "Out of Memory while allocating buffer for "#t" of size "#s); \
00039   } \
00040 }
00041 
00046 #define GF_RESIZE(v,t,s) \
00047 { \
00048   v = (t*)realloc(v, (s) * sizeof(t)); \
00049   if ((v) == NULL) { \
00050     throw OutOfMemoryException( \
00051         "Out of Memory while resizing buffer for "#t); \
00052   } \
00053 }
00054 
00055 #define GF_FREE(v) free(v)

00077   inline void write(uint8_t value)
00078   {
00079     ensureCapacity(1);
00080     writeNoCheck(value);
00081   }

00099   {

00109   inline void writeBytes( const uint8_t* bytes, int32_t len )
00110   {
00111     if (len >= 0) {
00112       ensureCapacity( len + 5 );
00113       writeArrayLen( bytes==NULL ? 0 : len ); // length of bytes...
00114       if ( len > 0 && bytes != NULL) {
00115         memcpy( m_buf, bytes, len );
00116         m_buf += len;
00117       }
00118     } else {
00119       write((int8_t) -1 );
00120     }
00121   }
00122

00130   {
00131     writeBytes( (const uint8_t*)bytes, len );
00132   }

00146   {
00147     ensureCapacity( len );
00148     memcpy( m_buf, bytes, len );
00149     m_buf += len;
00150   }

00173   inline void writeInt( uint16_t value )
00174   {
00175     ensureCapacity( 2 );
00176     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 8);
00177     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)value;
00178   }

00185   inline void writeChar( uint16_t value )
00186   {
00187     ensureCapacity( 2 );
00188     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 8);
00189     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)value;
00190   }

00197   inline void writeInt( uint32_t value )
00198   {
00199     ensureCapacity( 4 );
00200     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 24);
00201     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 16);
00202     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 8);
00203     *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)value;
00204   }
00205 
00211   inline void writeInt( uint64_t value )
00212   {
00213     ensureCapacity( 8 );
00214     // the defines are not reliable and can be changed by compiler options.
00215     // Hence using sizeof() test instead.
00216     //#if defined(_LP64) || ( defined(__WORDSIZE) && __WORDSIZE == 64 ) ||
00217     //( defined(_INTEGRAL_MAX_BITS) && _INTEGRAL_MAX_BITS >= 64 )
00218     if ( sizeof( long ) == 8 ) {
00219       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 56);
00220       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 48);
00221       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 40);
00222       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 32);
00223       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 24);
00224       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 16);
00225       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(value >> 8);
00226       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)value;
00227     } else {
00228       uint32_t hword = (uint32_t)(value >> 32);
00229       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(hword >> 24);
00230       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(hword >> 16);
00231       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(hword >> 8);
00232       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)hword;
00233 
00234       hword = (uint32_t)value;
00235       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(hword >> 24);
00236       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(hword >> 16);
00237       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)(hword >> 8);
00238       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)hword;
00239     }
00240   }

00279   inline void writeArrayLen( int32_t len )
00280   {
00281     if (len == -1) {
00282       write((int8_t) -1);
00283     } else if (len <= 252) { // 252 is java's ((byte)-4 && 0xFF)
00284       write((uint8_t)len);
00285     } else if (len <= 0xFFFF) {
00286       write((int8_t) -2);
00287       writeInt((uint16_t)len);
00288     } else {
00289       write((int8_t) -3);
00290       writeInt(len);
00291     }
00292   }
00293 
00299   inline void writeFloat( float value )
00300   {
00301     union float_uint32_t
00302     {
00303         float f;
00304         uint32_t u;
00305     }v;
00306     v.f = value;
00307     writeInt( v.u );
00308   }
00309 
00315   inline void writeDouble( double value )
00316   {
00317     union double_uint64_t
00318     {
00319         double d;
00320         uint64_t        ll;
00321     }v;
00322     v.d =  value;
00323     writeInt( v.ll );
00324   }

00338   inline void writeASCII(const char* value, uint32_t length = 0)
00339   {
00340     if ( value != NULL ) {
00341       if ( length == 0 ) {
00342         length = (uint32_t)strlen( value );
00343       }
00344       uint16_t len = (uint16_t)( length > 0xFFFF ? 0xFFFF : length );
00345       writeInt( len );
00346       writeBytesOnly( (int8_t*)value, len ); // K64
00347     } else {
00348       writeInt( (uint16_t)0 );
00349     }
00350   }

00352   inline void writeNativeString(const char* value)
00353   {
00354     //create cacheable string
00355     //write typeid id.
00356     //call todata
00357     CacheableStringPtr csPtr = CacheableString::create(value);
00358     write(csPtr->typeId());
00359     csPtr->toData(*this);
00360   }

00373   inline void writeASCIIHuge(const char* value, uint32_t length = 0)
00374   {
00375     if ( value != NULL ) {
00376       if ( length == 0 ) {
00377         length = (uint32_t)strlen( value );
00378       }
00379       writeInt( (uint32_t) length );
00380       writeBytesOnly( (int8_t*)value, (uint32_t) length );
00381     } else {
00382       writeInt( (uint32_t)0 );
00383     }
00384   }

00397   inline void writeUTF(const char* value, uint32_t length = 0)
00398   {
00399     if ( value != NULL ) {
00400       int32_t len = getEncodedLength( value, length );
00401       uint16_t encodedLen = (uint16_t)( len > 0xFFFF ? 0xFFFF : len );
00402       writeInt( encodedLen );
00403       ensureCapacity( encodedLen );
00404       uint8_t* end = m_buf + encodedLen;
00405       while( m_buf < end ) {
00406         encodeChar( *value++ );
00407       }
00408       if ( m_buf > end ) m_buf = end;
00409     } else {
00410       writeInt( (uint16_t)0 );
00411     }
00412   }
00413 
00426   inline void writeUTFHuge(const char* value, uint32_t length = 0)
00427   {
00428     if (value != NULL) {
00429       if (length == 0) {
00430         length = (uint32_t)strlen(value);
00431       }
00432       writeInt(length);
00433       ensureCapacity(length * 2);
00434       for (uint32_t pos = 0; pos < length; pos++) {
00435         writeNoCheck((int8_t)0);
00436         writeNoCheck((int8_t)value[pos]);
00437       }
00438     }
00439     else {
00440       writeInt((uint32_t)0);
00441     }
00442   }
00443 
00455   inline void writeUTF(const wchar_t* value, uint32_t length = 0)
00456   {
00457     if ( value != NULL ) {
00458       int32_t len = getEncodedLength( value, length );
00459       uint16_t encodedLen = (uint16_t)( len > 0xFFFF ? 0xFFFF : len );
00460       writeInt( encodedLen );
00461       ensureCapacity( encodedLen );
00462       uint8_t* end = m_buf + encodedLen;
00463       while( m_buf < end ) {
00464         encodeChar( *value++ );
00465       }
00466       if ( m_buf > end ) m_buf = end;
00467     } else {
00468       writeInt( (uint16_t)0 );
00469     }
00470   }
00471 
00482   inline void writeUTFHuge(const wchar_t* value, uint32_t length = 0)
00483   {
00484     if (value != NULL) {
00485       if (length == 0) {
00486         length = (uint32_t)wcslen(value);
00487       }
00488       writeInt(length);
00489       ensureCapacity(length * 2);
00490       for (uint32_t pos = 0; pos < length; pos++) {
00491         uint16_t item = (uint16_t)value[pos];
00492         writeNoCheck((uint8_t)((item & 0xFF00) >> 8));
00493         writeNoCheck((uint8_t)(item & 0xFF));
00494       }
00495     }
00496     else {
00497       writeInt((uint32_t)0);
00498     }
00499   }
00500 
00511   inline static int32_t getEncodedLength( const char* value,
00512       int32_t length = 0, uint32_t* valLength = NULL )
00513   {
00514     if ( value == NULL ) return 0;
00515     uint8_t currentChar;
00516     int32_t encodedLen = 0;
00517     const char* start = value;
00518     if ( length == 0 ) {
00519       while ( (currentChar = *value) != '\0' ) {
00520         getEncodedLength( currentChar, encodedLen );
00521         value++;
00522       }
00523     } else {
00524       const char* end = value + length;
00525       while ( value < end ) {
00526         currentChar = *value;
00527         getEncodedLength( currentChar, encodedLen );
00528         value++;
00529       }
00530     }
00531     if ( valLength != NULL ) {
00532       *valLength = static_cast<uint32_t>(value - start);
00533     }
00534     return encodedLen;
00535   }
00536 
00547   inline static int32_t getEncodedLength( const wchar_t* value,
00548       int32_t length = 0, uint32_t* valLength = NULL )
00549   {
00550     if ( value == NULL ) return 0;
00551     uint16_t currentChar;
00552     int32_t encodedLen = 0;
00553     const wchar_t* start = value;
00554     if ( length == 0 ) {
00555       while ( (currentChar = *value) != 0 ) {
00556         getEncodedLength( currentChar, encodedLen );
00557         value++;
00558       }
00559     } else {
00560       const wchar_t* end = value + length;
00561       while ( value < end ) {
00562         currentChar = *value;
00563         getEncodedLength( currentChar, encodedLen );
00564         value++;
00565       }
00566     }
00567     if ( valLength != NULL ) {
00568       *valLength = static_cast<uint32_t>(value - start);
00569     }
00570     return encodedLen;
00571   }

00673   inline uint8_t* getBufferCopy( )
00674   {
00675     uint32_t size = (uint32_t)( m_buf - m_bytes );
00676     uint8_t * result;
00677     GF_ALLOC(result, uint8_t, size);
00678     memcpy( result, m_bytes, size );
00679     return result;
00680   }

00686   inline uint32_t getBufferLength() const {
00687     return (uint32_t)( m_buf - m_bytes );
00688   }
00689 
00693   inline void reset()
00694   {
00695     if (m_haveBigBuffer) {
00696       // free existing buffer
00697       GF_FREE(m_bytes);
00698       // create smaller buffer
00699       GF_ALLOC(m_bytes, uint8_t, m_lowWaterMark);
00700       m_size = m_lowWaterMark;
00701       // reset the flag
00702       m_haveBigBuffer = false;
00703       // release the lock
00704       releaseLock();
00705     }
00706     m_buf = m_bytes;
00707   }
00708 
00709   // make sure there is room left for the requested size item.
00710   inline void ensureCapacity( uint32_t size )
00711   {
00712     uint32_t offset = (uint32_t)( m_buf - m_bytes );
00713     if ( (m_size - offset) < size ) {
00714       uint32_t newSize = m_size * 2 + (8192 * (size / 8192));
00715       if (newSize >= m_highWaterMark && !m_haveBigBuffer) {
00716         // acquire the lock
00717         acquireLock();
00718         // set flag
00719         m_haveBigBuffer = true;
00720       }
00721       m_size = newSize;
00722       GF_RESIZE( m_bytes, uint8_t, m_size );
00723       m_buf = m_bytes + offset;
00724     }
00725   }

00774   const char* m_poolName;
00775   // memory m_buffer to encode to.
00776   uint8_t* m_bytes;
00777   // cursor.
00778   uint8_t* m_buf;
00779   // size of m_bytes.
00780   uint32_t m_size;
00781   // high and low water marks for buffer size
00782   static uint32_t m_lowWaterMark;
00783   static uint32_t m_highWaterMark;
00784   // flag to indicate we have a big buffer
00785   volatile bool m_haveBigBuffer;
00786 
00787   inline static void getEncodedLength( const uint8_t val, int32_t& encodedLen )
00788   {
00789     if ( (val == 0) || (val & 0x80) ) {
00790       // two byte.
00791       encodedLen += 2;
00792     } else {
00793       // one byte.
00794       encodedLen++;
00795     }
00796   }
00797 
00798   inline static void getEncodedLength( const uint16_t val, int32_t& encodedLen )
00799   {
00800     if( val == 0)
00801     {
00802       encodedLen += 2;
00803     }
00804     else if ( val < 0x80 )//ASCII character
00805     {
00806       encodedLen++;
00807     }
00808     else if ( val < 0x800 )
00809     {
00810       encodedLen += 2;
00811     }
00812     else
00813     {
00814        encodedLen += 3;
00815     }
00816   }
00817 
00818   inline void encodeChar( const char value )
00819   {
00820     uint8_t tmp = (uint8_t)value;
00821     if ( (tmp == 0) || (tmp & 0x80) ) {
00822       // two byte.
00823       *(m_buf++) = 0xc0 | ((tmp & 0xc0 ) >> 6);
00824       *(m_buf++) = 0x80 | (tmp & 0x3f );
00825     } else {
00826       // one byte.
00827       *(m_buf++) = tmp;
00828     }
00829   }
00830 
00831   // this will lose the character set encoding.
00832   inline void encodeChar( const wchar_t value )
00833   {
00834     uint16_t c = (uint16_t)value;
00835     if ( c == 0 ) {
00836       *(m_buf++) = 0xc0;
00837       *(m_buf++) = 0x80;
00838     }
00839     else if ( c < 0x80 ) {//ASCII character
00840       *(m_buf++) = (uint8_t)c;
00841     }
00842     else if ( c < 0x800 ) {
00843       *(m_buf++) = ( 0xC0 | c >> 6 );
00844       *(m_buf++) = ( 0x80 | (c & 0x3F) );
00845     }
00846     else {
00847       *(m_buf++) = ( 0xE0 | c >> 12 );
00848       *(m_buf++) = ( 0x80 | ((c >> 6) & 0x3F) );
00849       *(m_buf++) = ( 0x80 | (c & 0x3F) );
00850     }
00851   }
00852 
00853   inline void writeNoCheck(uint8_t value)
00854   {
00855     *(m_buf++) = value;
00856   }
00857 
00858   inline void writeNoCheck(int8_t value)
00859   {
00860     writeNoCheck((uint8_t)value);
00861   }
00862 
00863 
00864   static uint8_t* checkoutBuffer( uint32_t* size );
00865   static void checkinBuffer( uint8_t* buffer, uint32_t size );
00866 
00867   // disable copy constructor and assignment
00868   DataOutput(const DataOutput&);
00869   DataOutput& operator =(const DataOutput&);
00870 };
